intro: Anthericum uyuiense, commonly known as the Uyui lily, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a rosette at the base. Anthericum uyuiense is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
